channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Tracking Hurricane Milton's destruction. And, why more Black men are backing the GOP
item.description: Hurricane Milton made landfall last night as a Category 3 storm with 120 mph winds. Today, we track its aftermath through Florida. And, why the GOP is gaining more Black male voters.
item.content:encoded:
Hurricane Milton made landfall last night as a Category 3 storm with 120 mph winds. Today, we track its aftermath through Florida. And, why the GOP is gaining more Black male voters.

(Image credit: MIGUEL J. RODRIGUEZ CARRILLO)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Taylor Lorenz leaves 'Washington Post' after rift with editors
item.description: Washington Post editors lost faith in former tech columnist Taylor Lorenz, who called President Biden a "war criminal" and initially misled them about it. She has launched a new digital magazine.
item.content:encoded:
Washington Post editors lost faith in former tech columnist Taylor Lorenz, who called President Biden a "war criminal" and initially misled them about it. She has launched a new digital magazine.

(Image credit: Emma McIntyre/Getty Images for TheRetaility.com)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Tesla is expected to unveil a robotaxi tonight: 5 things to know
item.description: On Thursday night, Tesla is holding a splashy event it’s calling “We, Robot.” CEO Elon Musk says fully autonomous vehicles are key to Tesla’s future, and for years he has promised they are coming.
item.content:encoded:
On Thursday night, Tesla is holding a splashy event it’s calling “We, Robot.” CEO Elon Musk says fully autonomous vehicles are key to Tesla’s future, and for years he has promised they are coming.

(Image credit: Etienne Laurent)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: These maps and images show what's left of Gaza, 1 year into the Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Israel's war with Hamas has destroyed much of Gaza. Recent analyses find that nearly 60% of buildings, nearly 70% of orchards and 68% of roads have been damaged or destroyed by the conflict.
item.content:encoded:
Israel's war with Hamas has destroyed much of Gaza. Recent analyses find that nearly 60% of buildings, nearly 70% of orchards and 68% of roads have been damaged or destroyed by the conflict.

(Image credit: Yahya Hassouna)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Wood

item.title: Some students are fighting to stay in college after the FAFSA delayed financial aid
item.description: Students had to make all kinds of decisions about college before knowing how much financial aid they would get. Now, many of them are scrambling to stay in school.
item.content:encoded:
Students had to make all kinds of decisions about college before knowing how much financial aid they would get. Now, many of them are scrambling to stay in school.

(Image credit: Richard Stephen/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: 'The Apprentice' director talks about the film Donald Trump doesn't want you to see
item.description: Ali Abbasi's new film The Apprentice shows ex-President Donald Trump's years as a real estate businessman under the tutelage of lawyer Roy Cohn. The film coincides with Trump seeking another term.
item.content:encoded:
The Apprentice.'/>

Ali Abbasi's new film The Apprentice shows ex-President Donald Trump's years as a real estate businessman under the tutelage of lawyer Roy Cohn. The film coincides with Trump seeking another term.

(Image credit: Pief Weyman)
item.dc:creator: Olivia Hampton

item.title: Millions without power as Milton churns across Florida
item.description: Florida residents are being encouraged to shelter in place, as hazards such as storm surges, tornadoes and high winds and flash flood warnings were extended into early Thursday morning.
item.content:encoded:
Florida residents are being encouraged to shelter in place, as hazards such as storm surges, tornadoes and high winds and flash flood warnings were extended into early Thursday morning.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: The death toll in a gang attack on a Haitian town rises to at least 115
item.description: The attack on residents of Pont-Sondé on Oct. 3 was one of the biggest massacres that Haiti has seen in recent history. The U.N. had previously said that at least 70 people were killed.
item.content:encoded:
The attack on residents of Pont-Sondé on Oct. 3 was one of the biggest massacres that Haiti has seen in recent history. The U.N. had previously said that at least 70 people were killed.

(Image credit: Odelyn Joseph)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Severe solar storm may stress power grids as U.S. deals with major hurricanes
item.description: A severe solar storm is headed to Earth that could stress power grids even more as the U.S. deals with major back-to-back hurricanes, space weather forecasters said Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
A severe solar storm is headed to Earth that could stress power grids even more as the U.S. deals with major back-to-back hurricanes, space weather forecasters said Wednesday.

(Image credit: Solar Dynamics Observatory/NASA via AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Photos: Hurricane Milton brings devastation across Florida
item.description: High winds from Hurricane Milton tore off the fiberglass roof of Tropicana Field in St. Petersburg, Florida, home of the Tampa Bay Rays.
item.content:encoded:
High winds from Hurricane Milton tore off the fiberglass roof of Tropicana Field in St. Petersburg, Florida, home of the Tampa Bay Rays.

(Image credit: Chris Urso)
item.dc:creator: Mhari Shaw
